medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset of sharp, severe abdominal pain in both lower quadrants.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in her usual state of health until 1 PM when the pain began suddenly while she was standing in her kitchen after having cereal. The pain has been constant, unremitting, and worsened by movement. She has never experienced this kind of pain before.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Scoliosis, back pain managed by facet injections, nephrolithiasis, hypertension, small right occipital hemorrhagic CVA (no residual deficits), irritable bowel syndrome. Last colonoscopy was positive for internal hemorrhoids and diverticulosis.
medical_history.social_history: Lives in an unspecified location, involved with her daughter.
